intro: Prismatomeris tetrandra var. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine flame vine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along stream banks and in moist, shaded areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in its native region.
